article.headline: Chicago St 72, Valparaiso 67
article.story: TULSA, Okla. (AP) -- Royce Parran scored 21 of his 23 points in the second half to help Chicago State rally for a 72-67 victory over Valparaiso in the Mid-Continent Conference Tournament quarterfinals on Sunday night. Parran, a sophomore guard who averages 9.3 points, was 5-of-8 from the field and 10-of-15 on free throws. Deji Akindele had 19 points and 10 rebounds for the sixth-seeded Cougars (9-18), who posted only their second win in nine conference tournament appearances. Craig Franklin added 14 points and four steals. Chicago State advanced to play seventh-seeded Oakland, Mich., in the semifinals on Monday. The loss snapped third-seeded Valparaiso's streak of 10 consecutive appearances in the conference finals. That was the longest current streak in Division I. Valparaiso had won the Mid-Con Tournament eight times during that span. Dan Oppland paced the Crusaders (15-16) with 20 points and six rebounds, opening the second half with a basket that put Valparaiso ahead by 11. The Cougars profited from a spurt in the final minutes of the game. The Cougars made 7-of-12 free throws to stretch their advantage. Parran sank two free throws for a 67-60 lead with 53 seconds left. Oppland drilled a 3-pointer with 43 seconds left. Parran made 4-of-6 free throws during the rest of the game to insure the Cougars' win. The Cougars set a tournament record for attempts as they made 29-of-53 free throws. Valparaiso was 25-of-32 from the line. Kenny Harris had 11 points and 13 rebounds for Valparaiso, which did not have a senior play in the game.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
